title: PUNT OF THE WEEK: Phone payment security firm PCI-Pal
text:
PCI-Pal posted full-year results which showed revenue up 40 per cent to £2.8m

What is it?

PCI-Pal helps businesses which take payments over the phone to secure and protect customers' payment card data.

What's the latest?

This month it posted full-year results which showed revenue up 40 per cent to £2.8million.

Losses widened, from £3.8million to £4.5million, but this was expected after it invested in North America.

Who backs it?

William Catchpole, one of PCI-Pal's founders who was ousted as chief executive last year, is still one of the largest shareholders – as are members of his family – and so is co-founder Geoff Forsyth.

Early-stage investors such as Octopus and Livingbridge VC are also among the top shareholders.

Why should you invest?

Analysts at Finncap noted this was the first full year since PCI-Pal moved onto the Amazon Web Services platform, and said 'sales progress has been excellent'.

The company also agreed a £2.8million debt facility with Shawbrook Bank.

And why shouldn't you?

PCI still needs to prove it can make a profit. As online payments become more prevalent, the telephone payments market may not be around forever.
